intro: Oenothera oklahomensis, commonly known as the Oklahoma evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Oenothera oklahomensis is often found in prairies and open woodlands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
